LIVERMORE VALLEY

Because of its thirty mile width, Livermore looks rather like a wide rolling plain than valley country. ‘Vhe vineyard soil appears coarse and gravelly—the temperature is higher than its neighboring wine valleys. These conditions are peculiarly adapted for the cultivation of the Sauternes variety of grape, i.e., the Semillon and Sauvignon Blanc. The Pinot Blanc and Grey Riesling also thrive here. ‘The outstanding Livermore wineries are Wente Brothers, Cresta Blanca, and Concannon.
